{"step_by_step_thinking": "The sequential arrangement of fetal scans involves multiple types of scans at different stages of pregnancy. The NT scan, or Nuchal Translucency scan, is typically done between 11 and 14 weeks of pregnancy. The Anomaly scan, also known as the mid-pregnancy scan, is done between 18 and 21 weeks. The Triple marker test is a blood test usually done between 15 and 20 weeks of pregnancy. The Growth scan is done later in pregnancy to check the baby's growth, usually after 28 weeks. Therefore, all the given options are part of the sequential arrangement of fetal scans.", "answer_choice": "D. All"}
